api¶

This module abstracts underlying calls to the Todoist API so that they may be performed in a simpler way. It is fundamentally a wrapper module that neither adds nor takes away any functionality that is provided by Todoist.

If you do not need access to the raw HTTP response to the request, consider using the higher level abstractions implemented in the todoist module.

Example:

>>> from pytodoist.api import TodoistAPI
>>> api = TodoistAPI()
>>> response = api.login('john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> user_info = response.json()
>>> user_info['email']
u'john.doe@gmail.com'
>>> user_info['full_name']
u'John Doe'
>>> user_token = user_info['token']
>>> response = api.ping(user_token)
>>> response.text
u'ok'
>>> response = api.get_projects(user_token)
>>> projects = response.json()
>>> len(projects)
2
class pytodoist.api.TodoistAPI[source]¶

A wrapper around the Todoist web API: https://todoist.com/API.

>>> from pytodoist.api import TodoistAPI
>>> api = TodoistAPI()
>>> api.URL
'https://www.todoist.com/API/'
add_label(token, label_name, **kwargs)[source]¶

Add a label.

If a label with the name already exists it will be returned.

Parameters:
  • token (string) – The user’s login token.
  • label_name (string) – The name of the label.
  • color (int) – The color of the label.
Returns:

The HTTP response to the request.
Return type:

requests.Response
On success:

response.json() will contain the label details.

 
>>> api = TodoistAPI()
>>> response = api.login('john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> user_info = response.json()
>>> user_token = user_info['token']
>>> response = api.add_label(user_token, 'football')
>>> label = response.json()
>>> label['name']
u'football'
add_note(token, task_id, note_content)[source]¶

Add a note to a task.

Parameters:
  • token (string) – The user’s login token.
  • task_id (string) – The ID of the task to add the note to.
  • note_content (string) – The note to add.
Returns:

The HTTP response to the request.
Return type:

requests.Response
On success:

response.json() will contain the note details.

 
>>> api = TodoistAPI()
>>> response = api.login('john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> user_info = response.json()
>>> user_token = user_info['token']
... # Get a task_id
>>> response = api.add_note(user_token, task_id, 'Call 0783766273')
>>> note = response.json()
>>> note['content']
u'Call 0783766273'
add_project(token, project_name, **kwargs)[source]¶

Add a new project to a user’s account.

Parameters:
  • token (string) – The user’s login token.
  • project_name – The name of the new project.
  • color (int) – The color of the new project.
  • indent (int) – The indentation of the new project (1-4).
  • order (int) – The order of the new project (1+).
Returns:

The HTTP response to the request.
Return type:

requests.Response
On success:

response.json() will contain the project details.
On failure:

response.text will contain "ERROR_NAME_IS_EMPTY".

 
>>> api = TodoistAPI()
>>> response = api.login('john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> user_info = response.json()
>>> user_token = user_info['token']
>>> response = api.add_project(user_token, 'Work')
>>> project = response.json()
>>> project['name']
u'Work'
add_task(token, content, **kwargs)[source]¶

Add a task to a project.

Parameters:
  • token (string) – The user’s login token.
  • content (string) – The task description.
  • project_id (string) – The project to add the task to. Defaults to Inbox
  • date_string (string) – The deadline date for the task.
  • priority (int) – The task priority (1-4).
  • indent (int) – The task indentation (1-4).
  • js_date (int) – If 1: new Date("Sun Apr 29 2007 23:59:59"), otherwise Sun Apr 2007 23:59:59.
  • item_order (int) – The task order.
  • children (string) – A list of child tasks IDs.
  • labels (string) – A list of label IDs.
  • assigned_by_uid (string) – The ID of the user who assigns current task. Accepts 0 or any user id from the list of project collaborators. If value is unset or invalid it will automatically be set up by your uid.
  • responsible_uid (string) – The id of user who is responsible for accomplishing the current task. Accepts 0 or any user id from the list of project collaborators. If the value is unset or invalid it will automatically be set to null.
  • note (string) – Content of a note to add.
Returns:

The HTTP response to the request.
Return type:

requests.Response
On success:

response.json() will contain the task details.
On failure:

response.status_code will be 400 or response.text will contain "ERROR_WRONG_DATE_SYNTAX"

 
>>> api = TodoistAPI()
>>> response = api.login('john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> user_info = response.json()
>>> user_token = user_info['token']
>>> response = api.add_task(user_token, 'Buy Milk')
>>> task = response.json()
>>> task['content']
u'Buy Milk'
advance_recurring_dates(token, task_ids, **kwargs)[source]¶

Update the recurring dates of a list of tasks. The date will be advanced to the next date with respect to their ‘date_string’.

Parameters:
  • token (string) – The user’s login token.
  • task_ids (string) – The IDs of the tasks to update.
  • js_date (int) – If 1: new Date("Sun Apr 29 2007 23:59:59"), otherwise Sun Apr 2007 23:59:59.
Returns:

The HTTP response to the request.
Return type:

requests.Response
On success:

response.json() will contain the list of updated tasks.

 
>>> api = TodoistAPI()
>>> response = api.login('john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> user_info = response.json()
>>> user_token = user_info['token']
>>> task_ids = ['2342', '4324']
>>> response = api.advance_recurring_dates(user_token, str(task_ids))
>>> tasks = response.json()
>>> len(tasks)
2
archive_project(token, project_id)[source]¶

Archive a user’s project.

Warning

Only works if the user has Todoist premium.

Parameters:
  • token (string) – The user’s login token.
  • project_id (string) – The ID of the project to archive.
Returns:

The HTTP response to the request.
Return type:

requests.Response
On success:

response.json() will contain a list of archived project IDs. e.g. [1234, 3435, 5235]. The list will be empty if the user does not have Todoist premium.

 
>>> api = TodoistAPI()
>>> response = api.login('john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> user_info = response.json()
>>> user_token = user_info['token']
>>> response = api.archive_project(user_token, '4837')
>>> archived_project_ids = response.json()
>>> archived_project_ids
[4837]
complete_tasks(token, task_ids, **kwargs)[source]¶

Complete a given list of tasks.

Parameters:
  • token (string) – The user’s login token.
  • task_ids (string) – The IDs of the tasks to complete.
  • in_history (int) – If 0, the tasks will not be moved to the history.
Returns:

The HTTP response to the request.
Return type:

requests.Response
On success:

response.text will contain "ok".

 
>>> api = TodoistAPI()
>>> response = api.login('john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> user_info = response.json()
>>> user_token = user_info['token']
>>> response = api.add_task(user_token, 'Buy Milk')
>>> task = response.json()
>>> task_id = task['id']
>>> task_ids = [task_id]
>>> response = api.complete_tasks(user_token, str(task_ids))
>>> response.text
u'"ok"'

delete_project(token, project_id)[source]¶

Delete a user’s project.

Parameters:
  • token (string) – The user’s login token.
  • project_id (string) – The ID of the project to delete.
Returns:

The HTTP response to the request.
Return type:

requests.Response
On success:

response.text will contain "ok".

 
>>> api = TodoistAPI()
>>> response = api.login('john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> user_info = response.json()
>>> user_token = user_info['token']
>>> response = api.get_project(user_token, '5436')
>>> project = response.json()
>>> project['name']
u'Work'
>>> project_id = project['id']
>>> api.delete_project(user_token, project_id)
>>> response = api.get_project(user_token, project_id)
>>> response.text
u'"ERROR_PROJECT_NOT_FOUND"'

delete_user(token, password, **kwargs)[source]¶

Delete a registered Todoist user’s account.

Parameters:
  • token (string) – A Todoist user’s login token.
  • password (string) – The user’s password.
  • reason_for_delete (string) – The reason for deletion.
  • in_background (int) – If 0, delete the user instantly.
Returns:

The HTTP response to the request.
Return type:

requests.Response
On success:

response.text will contain "ok".
On failure:

response.status_code will be 403.

 
>>> api = TodoistAPI()
>>> response = api.login('john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> user_info = response.json()
>>> user_token = user_info['token']
>>> response = api.delete_user(user_token, 'passwd')
>>> response.text
u'ok'
get_all_completed_tasks(token, **kwargs)[source]¶

Return a list of a user’s completed tasks.

Warning

Only works if the user has Todoist premium.

Parameters:
  • token (string) – The user’s login token.
  • project_id (string) – Filter the tasks by project.
  • js_date (int) – If 1: new Date("Sun Apr 29 2007 23:59:59"), otherwise Sun Apr 2007 23:59:59.
  • label (string) – Filter the tasks by label.
  • interval (string) – Filter the tasks by time range. Defaults to past 2 weeks.
Returns:

The HTTP response to the request.
Return type:

requests.Response
On success:

response.json() will contain a list of tasks. The list will be empty is the user does not have Todoist premium.
On failure:

response.status_code will be 400.

 
>>> api = TodoistAPI()
>>> response = api.login('john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> user_info = response.json()
>>> user_token = user_info['token']
>>> response = api.get_all_completed_tasks(user_token)
>>> completed_tasks = response.json()
>>> len(uncompleted_tasks)
0
get_completed_tasks(token, project_id, **kwargs)[source]¶

Return a list of a project’s completed tasks.

Parameters:
  • token (string) – The user’s login token.
  • project_id (string) – The project to get tasks from.
  • js_date (int) – If 1: new Date("Sun Apr 29 2007 23:59:59"), otherwise Sun Apr 2007 23:59:59.
Returns:

The HTTP response to the request.
Return type:

requests.Response
On success:

response.json() will contain a list of tasks.
On failure:

response.status_code will be 400.

 
>>> api = TodoistAPI()
>>> response = api.login('john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> user_info = response.json()
>>> user_token = user_info['token']
>>> response = api.get_projects(user_token)
>>> projects = response.json()
>>> project_id = projects[0]['id']
>>> response = api.get_completed_tasks(user_token, project_id)
>>> completed_tasks = response.json()
>>> len(uncompleted_tasks)
0
get_labels(token, **kwargs)[source]¶

Return all of a user’s labels.

Parameters:
  • token (string) – The user’s login token.
  • as_list (int) – If 1, return a list of label names only.
Returns:

The HTTP response to the request.
Return type:

requests.Response
On success:

response.json() will contain a map of label name -> label details.

 
>>> api = TodoistAPI()
>>> response = api.login('john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> user_info = response.json()
>>> user_token = user_info['token']
>>> api.add_label(user_token, 'football')
>>> response = api.get_labels(user_token)
>>> labels = response.json()
>>> for label in labels.values():
...     label['name']
...
u'football'

get_notes_and_task(token, task_id)[source]¶

Return the list of notes for a task and the task itself.

Parameters:
  • token (string) – The user’s login token.
  • task_id (string) – The ID of the task.
Returns:

The HTTP response to the request.
Return type:

requests.Response
On success:

response.json() will contain the task and notes.

 
>>> api = TodoistAPI()
>>> response = api.login('john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> user_info = response.json()
>>> user_token = user_info['token']
... # Get task_id
>>> response = api.get_notes_and_task(user_token, task_id)
>>> results = response.json()
>>> notes = results['notes']
>>> task = results['item']

Return a user’s notification settings.

Parameters:token (string) – The user’s login token.
Returns:The HTTP response to the request.
Return type:requests.Response

>>> api = TodoistAPI()

>>> user_info = response.json()
>>> user_token = user_info['token']
>>> response = api.get_notification_settings(user_token)
>>> response.json()
{u'user_left_project':
    {u'notify_push': True, u'notify_email': False},
...}

The HTTP response to the request.

requests.Response

response.json() will contain a list of tasks.

get_timezones()[source]¶

Return the timezones that Todoist supports.

Returns:The HTTP response to the request.
Return type:requests.Response
On success:response.json() will contain the supported timezones. 
>>> api = TodoistAPI()
>>> response = api.get_timezones()
>>> response.json()
[[u'US/Hawaii', u'(GMT-1000) Hawaii'], ...]

login(email, password)[source]¶

Login to Todoist.

Parameters:
  • email (string) – A Todoist user’s email.
  • password (string) – A Todoist user’s password.
Returns:

The HTTP response to the request.
Return type:

requests.Response
On success:

response.json() will contain the user details.
On failure:

response.text will contain "LOGIN_ERROR".

 
>>> api = TodoistAPI()
>>> response = api.login('john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> user_info = response.json()
>>> user_info['email']
u'john.doe@gmail.com'
login_with_google(email, oauth2_token, **kwargs)[source]¶

Login to Todoist using Google’s oauth2 authentication.

Parameters:
  • email (string) – A Todoist user’s Google email.
  • oauth2_token (string) – A valid oauth2_token for the user retrieved from Google’s oauth2 service.
  • auto_signup (int) – Register an account if this is 1 and no user is found.
  • full_name (string) – A full name to use if the user is registering. If no name is given, an email based nickname is used.
  • timezone (string) – A timezone to use if the user is registering. If not set, one is chosen based on the user’s IP address.
Returns:

The HTTP response to the request.
Return type:

requests.Response
On success:

response.json() will contain the user details.
On failure:

response.text will contain "LOGIN_ERROR", "INTERNAL_ERROR", "EMAIL_MISMATCH" or "ACCOUNT_NOT_CONNECTED_WITH_GOOGLE".

 
>>> oauth2_token = get_token() # You must get the token somehow!
>>> api = TodoistAPI()
>>> response = api.login_with_google('john.doe@gmail.com', oauth2_token,
                                      auto_signup=1)
>>> user_info = response.json()
>>> user_info['email']
u'john.doe@gmail.com'
move_tasks(token, task_locations, project_id)[source]¶

Move tasks to another project.

Parameters:
  • token (string) – The user’s login token.
  • task_locations (string) – The current locations of the tasks to move. It is a map of project_id -> task_id e.g. {'1534': ['23453']}.
  • project_id (string) – The project to move the tasks to.
Returns:

The HTTP response to the request.
Return type:

requests.Response
On success:

response.json() will contain the task counts of each project e.g. {"counts": {"1523": 0, "1245": 1}}.

 
>>> api = TodoistAPI()
>>> response = api.login('john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> user_info = response.json()
>>> user_token = user_info['token']
... # Get the locations of the tasks to move.
... # and the project to move them to.
>>> response = api.move_tasks(user_token, task_locations, project_id)
>>> response.json()
{"counts": {"1523": 0, "1245": 1}}
ping(token)[source]¶

Test a user’s login token.

A valid token is required to perform many of the API operations.

Parameters:token (string) – A Todoist user’s login token.
Returns:The HTTP response to the request.
Return type:requests.Response
On success:response.text will contain "ok".
On failure:response.status_code will be 401. 
>>> api = TodoistAPI()
>>> response = api.login('john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> user_info = response.json()
>>> user_token = user_info['token']
>>> response = api.ping(user_token)
>>> response.text
u"ok"
register(email, full_name, password, **kwargs)[source]¶

Register a new user on Todoist.

Parameters:
  • email (string) – The user’s email.
  • full_name (string) – The user’s full name.
  • password (string) – The user’s password. Must be 4 chars.
  • lang (string) – The user’s language.
  • timezone (string) – The user’s timezone.
Returns:

The HTTP response to the request.
Return type:

requests.Response
On success:

response.json() will contain the user’s details.
On failure:

response.text will contain "ALREADY_REGISTRED", "TOO_SHORT_PASSWORD", "INVALID_EMAIL", "INVALID_TIMEZONE", "INVALID_FULL_NAME" or "UNKNOWN_ERROR".

 
>>> api = TodoistAPI()]
>>> response = api.register('john.doe@gmail.com', 'John Doe', 'passwd')
>>> user_info = response.json()
>>> user_info['email']
u'john.doe@gmail.com'
search_tasks(token, queries, **kwargs)[source]¶

Return the list of tasks, each of which matches one of the provided queries.

Parameters:
  • token (string) – The user’s login token.
  • queries (string) – A list of queries.
  • as_count (int) – If 1, a count of the tasks will be returned.
  • js_date (int) – If 1: new Date("Sun Apr 29 2007 23:59:59"), otherwise Sun Apr 2007 23:59:59.
Returns:

The HTTP response to the request.
Return type:

requests.Response
On success:

response.json() will contain a list of queries and the tasks that matched them.

Note

See https://todoist.com/Help/timeQuery for valid queries.

>>> api = TodoistAPI()
>>> response = api.login('john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> user_info = response.json()
>>> user_token = user_info['token']
>>> queries = str(['tomorrow'])
>>> response = api.search_tasks(user_token, queries, as_count=1)
>>> counts = response.json()
>>> counts
'[{"count": 0, "query": "tomorrow", "type": "date"}]'

uncomplete_tasks(token, task_ids)[source]¶

Uncomplete a given list of tasks.

Parameters:
  • token (string) – The user’s login token.
  • task_ids (string) – The IDs of the tasks to complete.
  • in_history (int) – If 0, the tasks will not be moved to the history.
Returns:

The HTTP response to the request.
Return type:

requests.Response
On success:

response.text will contain "ok".

 
>>> api = TodoistAPI()
>>> response = api.login('john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> user_info = response.json()
>>> user_token = user_info['token']
>>> response = api.add_task(user_token, 'Buy Milk')
>>> task = response.json()
>>> task_id = task['id']
>>> task_ids = [task_id]
>>> api.complete_tasks(user_token, str(task_ids))
>>> response = api.complete_tasks(user_token, str(task_ids))
>>> response.text
u'"ok"'
update_avatar(token, **kwargs)[source]¶

Update a registered Todoist user’s avatar.

Parameters:
  • token (string) – The user’s login token.
  • image (string) – The image. Must be encoded with multipart/form-data. The maximum size is 2mb.
  • delete (int) – If 1, delete the current avatar and use the default.
Returns:

The HTTP response to the request.
Return type:

requests.Response
On success:

response.json() will contain the updated user details.
On failure:

response.text will contain "UNKNOWN_IMAGE_FORMAT", "UNABLE_TO_RESIZE_IMAGE" or "IMAGE_TOO_BIG".

 
>>> api = TodoistAPI()
>>> response = api.login('john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> user_info = response.json()
>>> user_token = user_info['token']
>>> api.update_avatar(user_token, delete=1) # Use default avatar.
update_label_color(token, label_name, color)[source]¶

Update the color of a user’s label.

Parameters:
  • token (string) – The user’s login token.
  • label_name (string) – The name of the label.
  • color (int) – The new color of the label.
Returns:

The HTTP response to the request.
Return type:

requests.Response
On success:

response.json() will contain the label details.

 
>>> api = TodoistAPI()
>>> response = api.login('john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> user_info = response.json()
>>> user_token = user_info['token']
>>> response = api.add_label(user_token, 'football', color=1)
>>> label = response.json()
>>> label['color']
1
>>> response = api.update_label_name(user_token, 'football', color=2)
>>> label = response.json()
>>> label['color']
2

  • label_name (string) – The current name of the label.
  • new_name (string) – The new name of the label.

The HTTP response to the request.
Return type:

requests.Response
On success:

response.json() will contain the label details.

 
>>> api = TodoistAPI()
>>> response = api.login('john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> user_info = response.json()
>>> user_token = user_info['token']
>>> response = api.add_label(user_token, 'football')

u'football'

>>> label['name']
u'soccer'

update_project(token, project_id, **kwargs)[source]¶

Update a user’s project.

Parameters:
  • token (string) – The user’s login token.
  • project_id (string) – The ID of a project.
  • name (string) – The new name.
  • color (int) – The new color.
  • indent (int) – The new indentation (1-4).
  • order (int) – The new order (1+).
  • collapsed (int) – If 1, collapse the project.
Returns:

The HTTP response to the request.
Return type:

requests.Response
On success:

response.json() will contain the updated details.
On failure:

response.status_code will be 400.

 
>>> api = TodoistAPI()
>>> response = api.login('john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> user_info = response.json()
>>> user_token = user_info['token']
>>> response = api.get_project(user_token, '5436')
>>> project = response.json()
>>> project['name']
u'Work'
>>> project_id = project['id']
>>> response = api.update_project(user_token, project_id, name='Play')
>>> project = response.json()
>>> project['name']
u'Play'
update_project_orders(token, ordered_project_ids)[source]¶

Update a user’s project orderings.

Parameters:
  • token (string) – The user’s login token.
  • ordered_project_ids (string) – An ordered list of project IDs.
Returns:

The HTTP response to the request.
Return type:

requests.Response
On success:

response.text will contain "ok".

 
>>> api = TodoistAPI()
>>> response = api.login('john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> user_info = response.json()
>>> user_token = user_info['token']
>>> response = api.get_projects(user_token)
>>> projects = response.json()
>>> reverse_order = [project['id'] for project in projects]
>>> api.update_project_orders(user_token, str(reverse_order))
update_task(token, task_id, **kwargs)[source]¶

Update the details of a task.

Parameters:
  • token (string) – The user’s login token.
  • task_id (string) – The ID of the task to update.
  • content (string) – The new task description.
  • project_id (string) – The new project.
  • date_string (string) – The new deadline date for the task.
  • priority (int) – The newtask priority (1-4).
  • indent (int) – The new task indentation (1-4).
  • js_date (int) – If 1: new Date("Sun Apr 29 2007 23:59:59"), otherwise Sun Apr 2007 23:59:59.
  • item_order (int) – The new task order.
  • children (string) – The new list of child tasks IDs.
  • labels (string) – The new list of label IDs.
  • assigned_by_uid (string) – The new ID of the user who assigns current task. Accepts 0 or any user id from the list of project collaborators. If value is unset or invalid it will automatically be set up by your uid.
  • responsible_uid (string) – The new id of user who is responsible for accomplishing the current task. Accepts 0 or any user id from the list of project collaborators. If the value is unset or invalid it will automatically be set to null.
  • note (string) – Content of a note to add.
Returns:

The HTTP response to the request.
Return type:

requests.Response
On success:

response.json() will contain the updated task details.
On failure:

response.text will contain "ERROR_ITEM_NOT_FOUND"

 
>>> api = TodoistAPI()
>>> response = api.login('john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> user_info = response.json()
>>> user_token = user_info['token']
>>> response = api.add_task(user_token, 'Buy Milk')
>>> task = response.json()
>>> task['content']
u'Buy Milk'
>>> task_id = task['id']
>>> response = api.update_task(user_token, task_id, content='Buy Bread')
>>> task = response.json()
>>> task['content']
u'Buy Bread'
update_task_ordering(token, project_id, task_ids)[source]¶

Update the order of a project’s tasks.

Parameters:
  • token (string) – The user’s login token.
  • project_id (string) – The new project.
  • task_ids (string) – An ordered list of task IDs.
Returns:

The HTTP response to the request.
Return type:

requests.Response
On success:

response.text will contain "ok"
On failure:

response.status_code will be 400

 
>>> api = TodoistAPI()
>>> response = api.login('john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> user_info = response.json()
>>> user_token = user_info['token']
... # Get Inbox project_id
>>> response = api.get_uncompleted_tasks(user_token, project_id)
>>> tasks = response.json()
>>> task_ids = [task['id'] for task in tasks]
>>> reverse_task_ids = str(task_ids[::-1])
>>> response = api.update_task_ordering(user_token, reverse_task_ids)
>>> response.text
u'"ok"'
update_user(token, **kwargs)[source]¶

Update a registered Todoist user’s account.

Parameters:
  • token (string) – The user’s login token.
  • email (string) – The new email address.
  • full_name (string) – The new full name.
  • password (string) – The new password.
  • timezone (string) – The new timezone.
  • date_format (int) – 0: DD-MM-YYYY, 1: MM-DD-YYYY.
  • time_format (int) – 0: 13:00. 1: 1:00pm.
  • start_day (int) – The new first day of the week (1-7, Mon-Sun).
  • next_week (int) – The new day to use when postponing (1-7, Mon-Sun).
  • start_page (string) – The new start page. _blank: for a blank page, _info_page for the info page, _project_$PROJECT_ID for a project page or $ANY_QUERY to show query results.
  • default_reminder – email for email, mobile for SMS, push for smart device notifications or no_default to turn off notifications.
Returns:

The HTTP response to the request.
Return type:

requests.Response
On success:

response.json() will contain the updated user details.
On failure:

response.status_code will be 400 or response.text will contain "ERROR_EMAIL_FOUND".

 
>>> api = TodoistAPI()
>>> response = api.login('john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> user_info = response.json()
>>> user_info['full_name']
u'John Doe'
>>> user_token = user_info['token']
>>> response = api.update_user(user_token, full_name='John Smith')
>>> user_info = response.json()
>>> user_info['full_name']
u'John Smith'
